anchor.surface_text: This question arose out of the assessment year 1950-51  previous calendar year 1949 . The assessee is limited companypany which owns a textile mill. It had paid Rs. 2,57,000 as bonus to its workers in respect of the calendar year 1947, and claimed its a deduction in respect of the assessment year 1950-51. A dispute had arisen between the workmen and the assessee and it was settled by an award made in January, 1949, by the tribunal under the Industrial Disputes Act. Following our decision and the reasoning in Commissioner of Income-tax v. Swadeshi Cotton and Flour Mills, we hold that the High Court was right in answering the question in the affirmative.
